@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Container, which allows, depending on the set variant qx.mobile.nativescroll, vertical and horizontal scrolling if the contents is larger than the container. Note that this class can only have one child widget. This container has a fixed layout, which cannot be changed. Example Here is a little example of how to use the widget. 


   var scroll = new qx.ui.mobile.container.Scroll();

   scroll.add(new qx.ui.mobile.basic.Label("Name: "));
   this.getRoot().add(scroll);

This example creates a scroll container and adds a label to it.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: scrollProperties {Object} A map with scroll properties which are passed to the scrolling container (may contain iScroll properties).
@param.description: A map with scroll properties which are passed to the scrolling container (may contain iScroll properties).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when the scroll container reaches its end position (including momentum/inertia).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when the user scrolls to the end of scroll area.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when a vertical or horizontal waypoint is triggered. Data: {"offset": 0, "input": "10%", "index": 0, "element" : 0}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when a momentum starts on an iOS device.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when a momentum ends on an iOS device.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Delegation object which can have one or more functions defined by the {@link qx.ui.mobile.container.IScrollDelegate} interface.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The owning object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: {String} The ID of the object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the current x position.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {Number} the current horizontal position.
@param.description: the current horizontal position.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the current y position.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {Number} the current vertical position.
@param.description: the current vertical position.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the horizontal trigger points, where a waypoint event will be fired.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: waypoints {Array} description
@param.description: description

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the vertical trigger points, where a waypoint event will be fired.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: waypoints {Array} an array with waypoint descriptions. Allowed are percentage description as string, or pixel trigger points defined as numbers. ["20%",200]
@param.description: an array with waypoint descriptions. Allowed are percentage description as string, or pixel trigger points defined as numbers. ["20%",200]

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the scroll height.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the scroll width.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Re-calculates the internal waypoint offsets.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Validates and checks the waypoint offsets.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: waypoints {Array} an array with waypoint descriptions.
@param.description: an array with waypoint descriptions.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: results {Array} the array where calculated waypoints will be added.
@param.description: the array where calculated waypoints will be added.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: scrollSize {Number} the vertical or horizontal scroll size.
@param.description: the vertical or horizontal scroll size.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: axis {String?} "x" or "y".
@param.description: "x" or "y".

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fires a waypoints event when scroll position changes.

@param.body: value {Number} old scroll position.
@param.description: old scroll position.

@param.description: old scroll position.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: axis {String} "x" or "y".
@param.description: "x" or "y".

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Calls the refresh function the used scrolling method. Needed to recalculate the scrolling container.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Scrolls the wrapper contents to the x/y coordinates in a given time.

@param.body: x {Integer} X coordinate to scroll to.
@param.description: X coordinate to scroll to.

@param.name: @param

@param.description: Y coordinate to scroll to.

@param.body:
time {Integer} Time slice in which scrolling should

@param.description:
Time slice in which scrolling should

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Determines the scroll offset for the _scrollToElement method. If a delegate is available, the method calls qx.ui.mobile.container.IScrollDelegate.getScrollOffset() for offset calculation.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Scrolls the wrapper contents to the widgets coordinates in a given period.

@param.body: widget {qx.ui.mobile.core.Widget} the widget, the scroll container should scroll to.
@param.description: the widget, the scroll container should scroll to.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
time {Integer} Time slice in which scrolling should
              be done.
@param.description:
Time slice in which scrolling should
              be done.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxOwner. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.
